p: Since it was previously reported that RBD may represent specific subtypes of PD [ 15], we compared PD+RBD ( n = 381) patients to PD-RBD ( n = 570) patients. Table 3 details the results of the analysis. After Bonferroni correction for multiple comparisons (set the cut-of p value on 0.0028) and after adjustment for sex and disease duration, higher frequencies of dyskinesia, fluctuations, postural hypotension and hallucinations were associated with PD+RBD ( Table 3). Constipation remained nominally more common in PD+RBD after correction for sex and disease duration but not statistically significant after Bonferroni correction.
